an2.64:1.1.eng: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.64:1.3.eng: The happiness of laypeople, and the happiness of renunciates.

an2.64:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.64:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ sukhānaṃ yadidaṃ pabbajitasukhan”ti.
an2.64:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of happiness is the happiness of renunciates.”

an2.65:1.1.eng: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.65:1.3.eng: Sensual happiness and the happiness of renunciation.

an2.65:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.65:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ sukhānaṃ yadidaṃ nekkhammasukhan”ti.
an2.65:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of happiness is the happiness of renunciation.”

an2.66:1.1.eng: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.66:1.3.eng: The happiness of attachments, and the happiness of no attachments.

an2.66:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.66:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ sukhānaṃ yadidaṃ nirupadhisukhan”ti.
an2.66:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of happiness is the happiness of no attachments.”

an2.67:1.1.eng: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.67:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.67:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ sukhānaṃ yadidaṃ anāsavasukhan”ti.
an2.67:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of happiness is the happiness of no defilements.”

an2.68:1.1.eng: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.68:1.3.eng: Happiness of the flesh and happiness not of the flesh.

an2.68:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.68:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ sukhānaṃ yadidaṃ nirāmisaṃ sukhan”ti.
an2.68:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of happiness is happiness not of the flesh.”

an2.69:1.1.eng: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.69:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.69:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ sukhānaṃ yadidaṃ ariyasukhan”ti.
an2.69:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of happiness is noble happiness.”

an2.70:1.1.eng: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.70:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.70:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ sukhānaṃ yadidaṃ cetasikaṃ sukhan”ti.
an2.70:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of happiness is mental happiness.”

an2.71:1.1.eng: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.71:1.3.eng: Happiness with rapture and happiness free of rapture.

an2.71:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.71:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ sukhānaṃ yadidaṃ nippītikaṃ sukhan”ti.
an2.71:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of happiness is happiness free of rapture.”

an2.72:1.1.eng: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.72:1.3.eng: Happiness with pleasure and happiness with equanimity.

an2.72:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.72:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ sukhānaṃ yadidaṃ upekkhāsukhan”ti.
an2.72:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of happiness is happiness with equanimity.”

an2.73:1.1.eng: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.73:1.3.eng: The happiness of immersion and the happiness without immersion.

an2.73:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.73:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ sukhānaṃ yadidaṃ samādhisukhan”ti.
an2.73:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of happiness is the happiness of immersion.”

an2.74:1.1.eng: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.74:1.3.eng: Happiness that relies on rapture and happiness that relies on freedom from rapture.

an2.74:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.74:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ sukhānaṃ yadidaṃ nippītikārammaṇaṃ sukhan”ti.
an2.74:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of happiness is happiness that relies on freedom from rapture.”

an2.75:1.1.eng: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.75:1.3.eng: Happiness that relies on pleasure and happiness that relies on equanimity.

an2.75:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.75:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ sukhānaṃ yadidaṃ upekkhārammaṇaṃ sukhan”ti.
an2.75:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of happiness is happiness that relies on equanimity.”

an2.76:1.1.eng: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.76:1.3.eng: Happiness that relies on form and happiness that relies on the formless.

an2.76:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.76:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ sukhānaṃ yadidaṃ arūpārammaṇaṃ sukhan”ti.
an2.76:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of happiness is happiness that relies on the formless.”

an2.77:1.1.pli: “Sanimittā, bhikkhave, uppajjanti pāpakā akusalā dhammā, no animittā.
an2.77:1.1.eng: “Bad, unskillful qualities, mendicants, arise with a basis, not without a basis.

an2.77:1.2.pli: Tasseva nimittassa pahānā evaṃ te pāpakā akusalā dhammā na hontī”ti.
an2.77:1.2.eng: By giving up that basis, those bad, unskillful qualities do not occur.”

an2.78:1.1.pli: “Sanidānā, bhikkhave, uppajjanti pāpakā akusalā dhammā, no anidānā.
an2.78:1.1.eng: “Bad, unskillful qualities, mendicants, arise with a source, not without a source.

an2.78:1.2.pli: Tasseva nidānassa pahānā evaṃ te pāpakā akusalā dhammā na hontī”ti.
an2.78:1.2.eng: By giving up that source, those bad, unskillful qualities do not occur.”

an2.79:1.1.pli: “Sahetukā, bhikkhave, uppajjanti pāpakā akusalā dhammā, no ahetukā.
an2.79:1.1.eng: “Bad, unskillful qualities, mendicants, arise with a cause, not without a cause.

an2.79:1.2.pli: Tasseva hetussa pahānā evaṃ te pāpakā akusalā dhammā na hontī”ti.
an2.79:1.2.eng: By giving up that cause, those bad, unskillful qualities do not occur.”

an2.80:1.1.pli: “Sasaṅkhārā, bhikkhave, uppajjanti pāpakā akusalā dhammā, no asaṅkhārā.
an2.80:1.1.eng: “Bad, unskillful qualities, mendicants, arise with conditions, not without conditions.

an2.80:1.2.pli: Tesaṃyeva saṅkhārānaṃ pahānā evaṃ te pāpakā akusalā dhammā na hontī”ti.
an2.80:1.2.eng: By giving up those conditions, those bad, unskillful qualities do not occur.”

an2.81:1.1.pli: “Sappaccayā, bhikkhave, uppajjanti pāpakā akusalā dhammā, no appaccayā.
an2.81:1.1.eng: “Bad, unskillful qualities, mendicants, arise with a reason, not without a reason.

an2.81:1.2.pli: Tasseva paccayassa pahānā evaṃ te pāpakā akusalā dhammā na hontī”ti.
an2.81:1.2.eng: By giving up that reason, those bad, unskillful qualities do not occur.”

an2.82:1.1.pli: “Sarūpā, bhikkhave, uppajjanti pāpakā akusalā dhammā, no arūpā.
an2.82:1.1.eng: “Bad, unskillful qualities, mendicants, arise with form, not without form.

an2.82:1.2.pli: Tasseva rūpassa pahānā evaṃ te pāpakā akusalā dhammā na hontī”ti.
an2.82:1.2.eng: By giving up that form, those bad, unskillful qualities do not occur.”

an2.83:1.1.pli: “Savedanā, bhikkhave, uppajjanti pāpakā akusalā dhammā, no avedanā.
an2.83:1.1.eng: “Bad, unskillful qualities, mendicants, arise with feeling, not without feeling.

an2.83:1.2.pli: Tassāyeva vedanāya pahānā evaṃ te pāpakā akusalā dhammā na hontī”ti.
an2.83:1.2.eng: By giving up that feeling, those bad, unskillful qualities do not occur.”

an2.84:1.1.pli: “Sasaññā, bhikkhave, uppajjanti pāpakā akusalā dhammā, no asaññā.
an2.84:1.1.eng: “Bad, unskillful qualities, mendicants, arise with perception, not without perception.

an2.84:1.2.pli: Tassāyeva saññāya pahānā evaṃ te pāpakā akusalā dhammā na hontī”ti.
an2.84:1.2.eng: By giving up that perception, those bad, unskillful qualities do not occur.”

an2.85:1.1.pli: “Saviññāṇā, bhikkhave, uppajjanti pāpakā akusalā dhammā, no aviññāṇā.
an2.85:1.1.eng: “Bad, unskillful qualities, mendicants, arise with consciousness, not without consciousness.

an2.85:1.2.pli: Tasseva viññāṇassa pahānā evaṃ te pāpakā akusalā dhammā na hontī”ti.
an2.85:1.2.eng: By giving up that consciousness, those bad, unskillful qualities do not occur.”

an2.86:1.1.pli: “Saṅkhatārammaṇā, bhikkhave, uppajjanti pāpakā akusalā dhammā, no asaṅkhatārammaṇā.
an2.86:1.1.eng: “Bad, unskillful qualities, mendicants, arise with a conditioned basis, not without a conditioned basis.

an2.86:1.2.pli: Tasseva saṅkhatassa pahānā evaṃ te pāpakā akusalā dhammā na hontī”ti.
an2.86:1.2.eng: By giving up that conditioned basis, those bad, unskillful qualities do not occur.”

an2.87:1.3.eng: Freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom.

an2.91:1.3.eng: Views favoring existence and views favoring nonexistence.

an2.94:1.3.eng: Being hard to admonish and having bad friends.

an2.95:1.3.eng: Being easy to admonish and having good friends.

an2.96:1.3.eng: Skill in the elements and skill in application of mind.

an2.97:1.3.eng: Skill in offenses and skill in resolving offenses.

an2.98:1.3.pli: Yo ca anāgataṃ bhāraṃ vahati, yo ca āgataṃ bhāraṃ na vahati.
an2.98:1.3.eng: One who carries the burden of what has not come to pass, and one who doesn’t carry the burden of what has come to pass.

an2.99:1.3.pli: Yo ca anāgataṃ bhāraṃ na vahati, yo ca āgataṃ bhāraṃ vahati.
an2.99:1.3.eng: One who doesn’t carry the burden of what has not come to pass, and one who carries the burden of what has come to pass.

an2.99:1.4.eng: These are the two who are astute.”

an2.100:1.3.pli: Yo ca akappiye kappiyasaññī, yo ca kappiye akappiyasaññī.
an2.100:1.3.eng: One who perceives what is unallowable as allowable, and one who perceives what is allowable as unallowable.

an2.101:1.3.pli: Yo ca akappiye akappiyasaññī, yo ca kappiye kappiyasaññī.
an2.101:1.3.eng: One who perceives what is unallowable as unallowable, and one who perceives what is allowable as allowable.

an2.101:1.4.eng: These are the two who are astute.”

an2.102:1.3.pli: Yo ca anāpattiyā āpattisaññī, yo ca āpattiyā anāpattisaññī.
an2.102:1.3.eng: One who perceives a non-offense as an offense, and one who perceives an offense as a non-offense.

an2.103:1.3.pli: Yo ca anāpattiyā anāpattisaññī, yo ca āpattiyā āpattisaññī.
an2.103:1.3.eng: One who perceives a non-offense as a non-offense, and one who perceives an offense as an offense.

an2.103:1.4.eng: These are the two who are astute.”

an2.104:1.3.pli: Yo ca adhamme dhammasaññī, yo ca dhamme adhammasaññī.
an2.104:1.3.eng: One who perceives what is not the teaching as the teaching, and one who perceives the teaching as not the teaching.

an2.105:1.3.pli: Yo ca dhamme dhammasaññī, yo ca adhamme adhammasaññī.
an2.105:1.3.eng: One who perceives the teaching as the teaching, and one who perceives what is not the teaching as not the teaching.

an2.105:1.4.eng: These are the two who are astute.”

an2.106:1.3.pli: Yo ca avinaye vinayasaññī, yo ca vinaye avinayasaññī.
an2.106:1.3.eng: One who perceives what is not the training as the training, and one who perceives what is the training as not the training.

an2.107:1.3.pli: Yo ca avinaye avinayasaññī, yo ca vinaye vinayasaññī.
an2.107:1.3.eng: One who perceives what is not the training as not the training, and one who perceives what is the training as the training.

an2.107:1.4.eng: These are the two who are astute.”

an2.108:1.3.pli: Yo ca na kukkuccāyitabbaṃ kukkuccāyati, yo ca kukkuccāyitabbaṃ na kukkuccāyati.
an2.108:1.3.eng: One who is remorseful over something they shouldn’t be, and one who isn’t remorseful over something they should be.

an2.108:1.4.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dvinnaṃ āsavā vaḍḍhantī”ti.
an2.108:1.4.eng: These are the two whose defilements grow.”

an2.109:1.3.pli: Yo ca na kukkuccāyitabbaṃ na kukkuccāyati, yo ca kukkuccāyitabbaṃ kukkuccāyati.
an2.109:1.3.eng: One who isn’t remorseful over something they shouldn’t be, and one who is remorseful over something they should be.

an2.109:1.4.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dvinnaṃ āsavā na vaḍḍhantī”ti.
an2.109:1.4.eng: These are the two whose defilements don’t grow.”

an2.110:1.3.pli: Yo ca akappiye kappiyasaññī, yo ca kappiye akappiyasaññī.
an2.110:1.3.eng: One who perceives what is unallowable as allowable, and one who perceives what is allowable as unallowable.

an2.110:1.4.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dvinnaṃ āsavā vaḍḍhantī”ti.
an2.110:1.4.eng: These are the two whose defilements grow.”

an2.111:1.3.pli: Yo ca akappiye akappiyasaññī, yo ca kappiye kappiyasaññī.
an2.111:1.3.eng: One who perceives what is unallowable as unallowable, and one who perceives what is allowable as allowable.

an2.111:1.4.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dvinnaṃ āsavā na vaḍḍhantī”ti.
an2.111:1.4.eng: These are the two whose defilements don’t grow.”

an2.112:1.3.pli: Yo ca āpattiyā anāpattisaññī, yo ca anāpattiyā āpattisaññī.
an2.112:1.3.eng: One who perceives an offense as a non-offense, and one who perceives a non-offense as an offense.

an2.112:1.4.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dvinnaṃ āsavā vaḍḍhantī”ti.
an2.112:1.4.eng: These are the two whose defilements grow.”

an2.113:1.3.pli: Yo ca āpattiyā āpattisaññī, yo ca anāpattiyā anāpattisaññī.
an2.113:1.3.eng: One who perceives an offense as an offense, and one who perceives a non-offense as a non-offense.

an2.113:1.4.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dvinnaṃ āsavā na vaḍḍhantī”ti.
an2.113:1.4.eng: These are the two whose defilements don’t grow.”

an2.114:1.3.pli: Yo ca adhamme dhammasaññī, yo ca dhamme adhammasaññī.
an2.114:1.3.eng: One who perceives what is not the teaching as the teaching, and one who perceives the teaching as not the teaching.

an2.114:1.4.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dvinnaṃ āsavā vaḍḍhantī”ti.
an2.114:1.4.eng: These are the two whose defilements grow.”

an2.115:1.3.pli: Yo ca dhamme dhammasaññī, yo ca adhamme adhammasaññī.
an2.115:1.3.eng: One who perceives the teaching as the teaching, and one who perceives what is not the teaching as not the teaching.

an2.115:1.4.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dvinnaṃ āsavā na vaḍḍhantī”ti.
an2.115:1.4.eng: These are the two whose defilements don’t grow.”

an2.116:1.3.pli: Yo ca avinaye vinayasaññī, yo ca vinaye avinayasaññī.
an2.116:1.3.eng: One who perceives what is not the training as the training, and one who perceives what is the training as not the training.

an2.116:1.4.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dvinnaṃ āsavā vaḍḍhantī”ti.
an2.116:1.4.eng: These are the two whose defilements grow.”

an2.117:1.3.pli: Yo ca avinaye avinayasaññī, yo ca vinaye vinayasaññī.
an2.117:1.3.eng: One who perceives what is not the training as not the training, and one who perceives what is the training as the training.

an2.117:1.4.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dvinnaṃ āsavā na vaḍḍhantī”ti.
an2.117:1.4.eng: These are the two whose defilements don’t grow.”
